column4: Ind[y] : Is your CD listed at teh top of /etc/apt/sources.list?
Ind[y] : what version of Ubuntu are you using?
Ind[y] : there's a program called apt-cdrom that you should be able to use to add the CD to your sources.list
Ind[y] : I only have a 6.06 server disc with me, but I'm certain it's there on the 6.10 desktop disc.
Indlet me know what that command does, I've never added a CD to my sources that way.
And he left before anyone else could tell him that.
Whats the point in telling someone why you can't help them?
I told him to use apt-cdrom add
coldpack: I don't know, I don't use a gui
Which should solve his problem, which is an inability to install a compiler due to a lack of internet access.
coldpack is not the one who asked, Ind[y]  was.
coldpack merely suggested an alternate solution.
